zc.thread
Class Semaphore

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.Semaphore
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lock
public class Semaphore
extends java.lang.Object
implements Lock

Implements the Dijkstra counting semaphore.

Conceptually, a Semaphore maintains a set of permits. Each acquire blocks if necessary until a permit is available, and then takes it. Each release release a permit.

Important: A Semaphore is not released when the thread that acquire it is interrupted; it is the responsibility of the interrupted thread to recover properly from a InterruptedException and to release all its acquired Semaphore.

example: 

  Semaphore theSemaphore = new Semaphore();
  try {
      theSemaphore.acquire();

      // We did acquire the semaphore and, from now on,
      // it is our responsibility to make sure we release it.

      try {
          // do something guarded by the semaphore
      }
      finally {
          theSemaphore.release();	// release the semaphore
      }
  }
  catch(InterruptedException e) {
      // The thread was interrupted before it
      // could acquire the semaphore, nothing to do.
  }

See Also:
"Concurrency - State Models & Java Programs, chap: 5.2, page: 87", Mutex, FIFOSemaphore

Constructor Detail

Semaphore

public Semaphore(int inValue)
Construct a Semaphore with the given number of permits.
Parameters:
inValue - the initial number of permit available. If the number is negative then that number of release call must be made before the first acquire pass.
Method Detail

acquire

public void acquire()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Acquire this semaphore.

If the number of available permits is less than or equal to zero then the calling thread will block until enough permits are made available or the thread is interrupted.

Specified by:
acquire in interface Lock
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - {@inheritDoc}

attempt

public boolean attempt(long msecs)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: Lock
Wait at most msecs or until successful passage in an attempt to acquire the Lock.
Specified by:
attempt in interface Lock
Following copied from interface: zc.thread.Lock
Parameters:
msecs - the number of milliseconds to wait for the Lock before giving up.
Returns:
true if the Lock has been acquired within the given time.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting. On failure, you can be sure that this Lock has not been acquired, and that no corresponding release should be performed. Conversely, a normal return guarantees that the acquire was successful.

release

public void release()
Release the semaphore, potentially enable another blocked Thread to pass.

NOTE: it is possible to release a semaphore more time than it was acquired, this is not considered an error, in this case, the same amount of acquire will pass without being bloqued.

release do not raise exceptions, thus it can be used in `finally' clauses without requiring extra try/catch blocks.

Specified by:
release in interface Lock

release

public void release(int n)
Release the semaphore n time. Equivalent in effect to, but more efficient than: 
  for(int i = 0 ; i < n ; ++i)
      release();
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative.

value

public int value()
Returns the number of available permits.
Returns:
an int, the number of time acquire can be called before the Semaphore will block.
